title: Grades 6-8: Level II, Novice High to Intermediate Low Proficiency
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

70D3D1D2DACE49188F006F4B91394EFC.description: describe people, objects, and situations orally and in writing using a series of sequenced sentences with essential details and simple elaboration.

BDDE212313FB48A3BAC2A6B5554D348D.description: express and support an opinion or preference orally and in writing with supporting statements; and

0041F63275D0439C98092F2085D5C512.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally and in writing using a mixture of phrases and sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

B4DC8D50344D49BC8CA5059F21DA2433.description: identify cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials.

1E1943D2C30747A3894F77FEE7C8BA93.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, and audiovisual materials; and

9E94B448BD5B4CCA941EE960B5DD2588.description: identify the main idea, theme, and supporting details from fiction and nonfiction texts and audio and audiovisual materials;

711BC18EBD9849A8B6504DAB0B9CCD82.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials in everyday contexts;

74E2D829F8EC42F49F112D4EC7CFC688.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends simple connected statements from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

72E2F02559874A0D9326B7225D8AA4B4.description: interact and react in writing using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and style.

EDDECA8E8C414275888683859C5D008A.description: interact and react in spoken conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and gestures; and

432D83B4E6D04719986F964E5456108E.description: articulate requests, offer alternatives, and develop plans with simple supporting statements in spoken and written conversation;

68008230D5544A7B8775C8749961FB14.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do with simple supporting reasons in spoken and written conversation;

FAEDA0178DED432BAF844C502C6355AE.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences with simple supporting statements in spoken and written conversation;

6F358F9DF8EB48EDB56FAA1BE570FDF4.description: ask and respond to questions about everyday life with simple elaboration in spoken and written conversation;

E2B2DF17247D4A589B6143BF6FFEF85C.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in rehearsed and unrehearsed situations in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of short statements and sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

E3DEE452011A4F9F911356B1C276A571.description: Level II, Novice High to Intermediate Low Proficiency
